title: Paul Gascoigne downed wine gums after sex assault court victory as he's now sober
text:

Paul Gascoigne said he celebrated being cleared of sexual assault by downing wine gums, as he is now sober.

The ex footballer, 52, was found not guilty in court this week after being accused of sexual assault by a woman he kissed on a train.

After struggling with addiction for years, Gazza is now sober, so he reached for his favourite sweets instead of the booze following the stress of the trial.

He said: "After the verdict I didn't want a beer. I was too exhausted.

"I had two packets of wine gums. That's as close as I got to drinking."

(Image: Jonathan Buckmaster)

In court, Gascoigne was said to have kissed the woman without her consent for four seconds in front of shocked passengers while the train was outside Darlington.

He maintains he only kissed the woman because she was being taunted over her weight by fellow passengers.

A jury at Teesside Crown Court took nearly three hours to clear him of sexual assault and assault by beating.

He explained that he was haunted by the death of his nephew, Jay Kerrigan, in 2016.

(Image: REUTERS)

An inquest ruled Jay accidentally overdosed on drugs at his girlfriend’s home.

The hearing was told that he had battled mental problems and was tormented by schoolyard bullies.

Gazza told the Sunday Mirror: “My nephew Jay died, he was bullied and I never want to see that happen to someone else.

(Image: PA)

(Image: REUTERS)

"All I was doing was sticking up for the girl.

“I gave the girl a peck. I didn’t mean anything sexual, I just heard what was said to her and wanted to help.

"If it was anyone else this would never have gone to court. I accept I’m not liked by everyone."

He called the last year a “nightmare" and said he had worked hard to stay sober in the last six months.

(Image: Jonathan Buckmaster)

(Image: Jonathan Buckmaster)

“I’ve been in trouble but nothing like this. I worried people would stop me going down the high street and shout abuse at me, or stop me from being around their kids", he said.

“I was thinking, ‘Have I let the fans down?’ Being on the sex offenders list – that’s not me.

"This is the hardest thing I’ve ever been through. There were times when I could have just f***ing locked the door, turned my phones off and just got bladdered.

“I’ve stayed strong – I’ve had to. Even talking about this I could walk out and go get pissed now. But I know alcohol would make it worse.”
description: Football legend Gazza tucked into two packets of wine gums after being cleared of sexual assault
